name: The Honorable Howland W. Abramson
assigned: PA - Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas
bio:
The Hon. Howland W. Abramson (Ret.) served as a judge for the Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas in Pennsylvania. He retired from the bench in 2011 and joined Panafrican Satellite Communications, Inc. as its Vice President and Chief Compliance Officer.

Before joining the bench, Abramson served as a deputy attorney general for the Pennsylvania Office of the Attorney General, where he represented the judicial branch of Pennsylvania and all its instrumentalities.

Abramson earned a B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1970. He then completed an M.B.A. at the University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School of Business (1972) and a J.D. at Temple University, James E. Beasley School of Law (1975).

His memberships have included the Judicial Ethics Committee of the Pennsylvania Conference of State Trial Judges.
